Recipe.Title: Mike's Baked Salmon

Background.Author: Mike Mueller
Background.History: I developed this dish while cooking at the Poulsbo Yacht Club

Recipe.Comments: Searing the fish before baking gives it a nice texture, and the curry powder adds a unique flavor. Serve with a fruit salsa or a mild chutney.

Directions.Step: Remove the skin from the fillet. Cut the fillet into 4 equal portions.
Mix the flour, curry powder, salt, and pepper in a shallow baking dish.
Dredge the salmon pieces in the flour mixture. Shake off the excess.
Spray an oven-proof skillet with cooking spray. Over medium high heat, sear the salmon for about 30 seconds on each side.
Place the skillet in the preheated oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until the salmon is just done. Do not overcook.
